content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: --STTPT
      operator: non_empty
    - name: --STRTPT
      operator: empty
Core:
  Id: CORE-000085
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: Raise an error when --STTPT is completed and --STRTPT is empty
Outcome:
  Message: --STTPT is completed and --STRTPT is empty
  Output Variables:
    - --STTPT
    - --STRTPT
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0059
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The characterization of the start of an observation
                  relative to a reference time point. The sponsor-defined reference
                  time point is in --STTPT.
                Document: Model v2.0
                Section: Timing
                Item: --STRTPT
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.3'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0059
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Identifies the start of the observation as being before
                  or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable
                  --STTPT.
                Document: Model v1.7
                Section: 2.2.5. Timing Variables for All Classes
                Item: Table 2.2.5.1, --STRTPT
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.2'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0059
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: (--STRTPT) Identifies the start of the observation
                  as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point
                  defined by variable --STTPT.
                Document: Model v1.4
                Section: 2.2.5 Timing Variables for All Classes
                Item: Specification
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: Raise an error when --STTPT is completed and --STRTPT is empty

Citations.Cited_Guidance: The characterization of the start of an observation relative to a reference time point. The sponsor-defined reference time point is in --STTPT.
Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable --STTPT.
(--STRTPT) Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable --STTPT.
